intro: Couepia coarctata, commonly known as the narrow-leaved couepia, is a species of flowering plant in the family Malvaceae. It is native to tropical regions of South America, particularly Brazil and Peru. The plant is characterized by its narrow, lance-shaped leaves and clusters of small, pale yellow flowers. It typically grows as a shrub or small tree, often in humid, lowland forests. The fruit is a capsule that contains numerous small, hairy seeds.
